path_1.title: Hereditary
path_1.feeling: Atmospheric grief horror that mistakes dread for depth

path_1.title: Quantum of Solace
path_1.feeling: Clipped, mean Bond I can vibe with despite the choppy plotting

path_1.title: Bottle Rocket
path_1.feeling: Loose, amiable caper with charm

path_1.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
path_1.feeling: Still hilarious, savage, and catchy - perfect chaos

path_1.title: Get Shorty
path_1.feeling: Sly, cool crime comedy that skewers Hollywood just right

path_1.title: Gridlock'd
path_1.feeling: Bleakly funny odyssey through red tape with surprising heart

path_1.title: FYRE: The Greatest Party That Never Happened
path_1.feeling: Watching a scam implode is deliciously infuriating

path_1.title: Requiem for a Dream
path_1.feeling: Viscerally effective, but the relentless misery wears me down

path_1.title: Videodrome
path_1.feeling: Visceral, weird, and prophetic - my kind of nightmare

path_1.title: Get Out
path_1.feeling: Sharp social thriller

path_1.title: Memento
path_1.feeling: Clever structure and mood carry it even if it runs a bit cold

path_1.title: ANIMA
path_1.feeling: Impeccable vibe, thin substance - cool, then gone

path_1.title: Sphere
path_1.feeling: Cool premise, soggy execution

path_1.title: Spotlight
path_1.feeling: Riveting, no-frills journalism drama that lands like a punch

path_1.title: The Hateful Eight
path_1.feeling: Talky, vicious, beautifully mean - I'm in

path_1.title: Knight's Tale, A
path_1.feeling: Cheeky mashup tone grates

path_1.title: Moonrise Kingdom
path_1.feeling: Too precious by half

path_1.title: Ring, The
path_1.feeling: Creepy hook, middling payoff

path_1.title: Avengers: Infinity War - Part II
path_1.feeling: Bloated superhero homework I can't be bothered to care about

path_1.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 – Parabellum
path_1.feeling: Gorgeous stunt craft

path_1.title: Out of Sight
path_1.feeling: Slick, funny, effortlessly cool - hits my crime sweet spot

path_1.title: Remember the Titans
path_1.feeling: Inspiration-by-numbers

path_1.title: What Women Want
path_1.feeling: Smug, dated rom-com energy

path_1.title: Eraser
path_1.feeling: Serviceable '90s action cheese

path_1.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
path_1.feeling: Grotesque, hilarious spiral - my kind of bad trip

path_1.title: Sphere
path_1.feeling: Moody setup that sinks under clunky writing

path_1.title: Sixth Sense, The
path_1.feeling: Solid slow-burn and neat twist, but not a favorite

path_1.title: Deadpool
path_1.feeling: Juvenile jokes that land often enough to overcome cape fatigue

path_1.title: Office Space
path_1.feeling: Pitch-perfect workplace rebellion

path_1.title: Captain America: The First Avenger
path_1.feeling: Cornball heroics I can't connect with

path_2.title: Hereditary (2018)
path_2.feeling: Well-crafted dread, but the occult family hysterics just don’t land for me.

path_2.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)
path_2.feeling: Clipped, angry Bond with flashes of momentum, undone by choppy chaos.

path_2.title: Bottle Rocket (1996)
path_2.feeling: Loose, low-stakes caper with enough dry charm and delinquent sweetness to work.

path_2.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut (1999)
path_2.feeling: Gloriously profane and catchy—still the gold standard for savage musical satire.

path_2.title: Get Shorty (1995)
path_2.feeling: Sly Hollywood-crime blend with smooth swagger and jokes that land without winking too hard.

path_2.title: Gridlock'd (1997)
path_2.feeling: Frustrated, funny bureaucratic nightmare with grit and heart in the right places.

path_2.title: FYRE: The Greatest Party That Never Happened (2019)
path_2.feeling: A slow-burn bonfire of hubris—delicious, damning schadenfreude.

path_2.title: Requiem for a Dream (2000)
path_2.feeling: Brutal and effective, but the stylistic hammering numbs me more than it devastates.

path_2.title: Videodrome (1983)
path_2.feeling: Cronenberg’s media-sickness fever dream—nasty, smart, and right in my lane.

path_2.title: Get Out (2017)
path_2.feeling: Sharp social horror with clean mechanics and a mean, satisfying bite.

path_2.title: Memento (2000)
path_2.feeling: Clever, cool puzzle-box noir that clicks more in concept than in gut.

path_2.title: ANIMA (2019)
path_2.feeling: Sleek vibes and choreography, but the PTA–Yorke trance doesn’t stick for me.

path_2.title: Sphere (1998)
path_2.feeling: Claustrophobic setup, limp mystery—the ideas outrun the execution.

path_2.title: Spotlight (2015)
path_2.feeling: Methodical, unshowy journalism that tightens the screws beautifully.

path_2.title: The Hateful Eight (2015)
path_2.feeling: Talky, poisonous snowbound standoff—my kind of vicious chamber piece.

path_2.title: Knight's Tale, A (2001)
path_2.feeling: Quippy medieval cosplay with pop sheen—too cutesy and weightless for me.

path_2.title: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
path_2.feeling: Meticulously twee and pleasant, but the whimsy keeps me at arm’s length.

path_2.title: Ring, The (2002)
path_2.feeling: Stylish, chilly investigation that works as a mystery more than a scare machine.

path_2.title: Avengers: Infinity War - Part II (2019)
path_2.feeling: Maxed-out fan-service spectacle that drowns any stakes in CG and quips.

path_2.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 – Parabellum (2019)
path_2.feeling: Operatic gun-fu pageant—impressive craft, thin nourishment.

path_2.title: Out of Sight (1998)
path_2.feeling: Cool, playful crime-romance with snap, chemistry, and Soderbergh glide.

path_2.title: Remember the Titans (2000)
path_2.feeling: Polished, predictable uplift that goes down easy and leaves little bite.

path_2.title: What Women Want (2000)
path_2.feeling: Glossy, smug rom-com gimmick that grates from minute one.

path_2.title: Eraser (1996)
path_2.feeling: Serviceable ’90s action cheese with a few fun bangs and not much aftertaste.

path_2.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (1998)
path_2.feeling: Grotesque, episodic bender—sporadically sharp, mostly indulgent.

path_2.title: Sphere (1998)
path_2.feeling: Moody setup, soggy payoff—lots of talk, little tension.

path_2.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_2.feeling: Clean, somber ghost story—effective craft, limited afterburn for me.

path_2.title: Deadpool (2016)
path_2.feeling: Rude, rapid-fire meta-jabs that amuse even as the superhero chassis bores me.

path_2.title: Office Space (1999)
path_2.feeling: Deadpan cubicle rebellion with enduring quotables and just-right bluntness.

path_2.title: Captain America: The First Avenger (2011)
path_2.feeling: Square, earnest origin story—competent, but too sanitized to spark.

path_2.title: Hereditary (2018)
path_2.feeling: Moody dread that curdles into hokey occult nonsense—impressive craft, not my flavor.

path_2.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)
path_2.feeling: Clipped, bruising Bond with momentum but thin villain and muddy stakes.

path_2.title: Bottle Rocket (1996)
path_2.feeling: Amiable, small-time caper with charm but a lightweight payoff.

path_2.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut (1999)
path_2.feeling: Gloriously filthy, catchy, and ruthlessly sharp—still kills me.

path_2.title: Get Shorty (1995)
path_2.feeling: Sly Hollywood-crime shuffle with smooth swagger and clean laughs.

path_2.title: Gridlock'd (1997)
path_2.feeling: Droll, bureaucratic nightmare with heart and grit that mostly lands.

path_2.title: FYRE: The Greatest Party That Never Happened (2019)
path_2.feeling: Delicious schadenfreude delivered with brisk, tabloid bite—fun if slight.

path_2.title: Requiem for a Dream (2000)
path_2.feeling: Relentless addiction spiral I respect more than I enjoy.

path_2.title: Videodrome (1983)
path_2.feeling: Nasty, visionary media mutation that burrows under the skin.

path_2.title: Get Out (2017)
path_2.feeling: Tight, nervy social thriller with sharp barbs and clean tension.

path_2.title: Memento (2000)
path_2.feeling: Lean puzzle-box noir—clever structure, a bit chilly emotionally.

path_2.title: ANIMA (2019)
path_2.feeling: Sleek Thom Yorke vibes and movement—cool textures, minor impact.

path_2.title: Sphere (1998)
path_2.feeling: Talky, inert sci-fi mystery that sinks under its own weight.

path_2.title: Spotlight (2015)
path_2.feeling: Unshowy, meticulous journalism grind that builds to real power.

path_2.title: The Hateful Eight (2015)
path_2.feeling: Profane, snowy chamber pressure cooker with a vicious snap.

path_2.title: Knight's Tale, A (2001)
path_2.feeling: Cheeky anachronisms can’t mask the fluff and corn.

path_2.title: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
path_2.feeling: Twee, precise diorama that I admire more than I feel.

path_2.title: Ring, The (2002)
path_2.feeling: Moody investigative creep-out with a clean hook and sturdy chills.

path_2.title: Avengers: Infinity War - Part II (2019)
path_2.feeling: Bombastic franchise homework with a few beats I admire, mostly bloat.

path_2.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 – Parabellum (2019)
path_2.feeling: Baroque action excess—impressive choreography, nearly zero pulse.

path_2.title: Out of Sight (1998)
path_2.feeling: Sly, sexy cat-and-mouse with slick rhythms and snap.

path_2.title: Remember the Titans (2000)
path_2.feeling: Glossy, formula comfort food with limited bite.

path_2.title: What Women Want (2000)
path_2.feeling: Smirky, dated high-concept that grates fast.

path_2.title: Eraser (1996)
path_2.feeling: Serviceable 90s shoot-’em-up with forgettable thrills.

path_2.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (1998)
path_2.feeling: Chaotic, druggy satire with flashes of bite and a lot of flab.

path_2.title: Sphere (1998)
path_2.feeling: Talky, inert sci-fi mystery that sinks under its own weight.

path_2.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_2.feeling: Measured ghost story with elegant restraint—even knowing the game, it plays.

path_2.title: Deadpool (2016)
path_2.feeling: Snarky, blood-slick superhero send-up that amuses more than it thrills.

path_2.title: Office Space (1999)
path_2.feeling: Deadpan workplace rebellion that hits the petty-annoyances bullseye.

path_2.title: Captain America: The First Avenger (2011)
path_2.feeling: Square, earnest origin story that goes down easy and disappears.

path_2.title: Hereditary (2018)
path_2.feeling: Well-crafted dread, but the occult melodrama leaves me rolling my eyes.

path_2.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)
path_2.feeling: Clipped, jittery Bond with momentum but thin bones.

path_2.title: Bottle Rocket (1996)
path_2.feeling: Shaggy, low-stakes caper with offbeat charm that goes down easy.

path_2.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut (1999)
path_2.feeling: Filthy, relentless musical anarchy that still kills me.

path_2.title: Get Shorty (1995)
path_2.feeling: Smooth Elmore Leonard rhythms—crime meets Hollywood with sly bite.

path_2.feeling: Body-horror media paranoia right in my bloodstream.

path_2.feeling: Clever clockwork noir I respect more than I feel.

path_2.title: ANIMA (2019)
path_2.feeling: Sleek vibes and choreography, minimal impact.

path_2.feeling: Glossy, inspirational boilerplate that goes down sugary.

path_3.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut (1999)
path_3.feeling: A perfect barrage of filth and satire—kills from start to finish.

path_3.title: Get Shorty (1995)
path_3.feeling: Breezy Elmore Leonard swagger—fun, light on real teeth.

path_3.title: Gridlock'd (1997)
path_3.feeling: Bureaucratic nightmare played dry and human—rough edges work.

path_3.title: FYRE: The Greatest Party That Never Happened (2019)
path_3.feeling: Petty grift autopsy with good laughs—cotton-candy outrage but tasty.

path_3.title: Requiem for a Dream (2000)
path_3.feeling: Stylized doom that grinds you down—ugly in the right ways.

path_3.title: Videodrome (1983)
path_3.feeling: Cronenberg’s media sickness—sleazy, smart, and perfectly warped.

path_3.title: Get Out (2017)
path_3.feeling: Sharp social paranoia with pulp snap—hits clean, a touch neat.

path_3.title: Memento (2000)
path_3.feeling: Clever clockwork noir—cool trick, limited bruise.

path_3.title: ANIMA (2019)
path_3.feeling: Slick mood piece—nice moves, thin meal.

path_3.title: Sphere (1998)
path_3.feeling: Talky deep-sea paranoia that never quite seals the hatch.

path_3.title: Spotlight (2015)
path_3.feeling: Buttoned-down fury—procedural done with clean, crushing force.

path_3.title: The Hateful Eight (2015)
path_3.feeling: Poisoned hangout turned bloodbath—gloriously mean and musical.

path_3.title: Knight's Tale, A (2001)
path_3.feeling: MTV medieval fluff—too cute by half for me.

path_3.title: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
path_3.feeling: Twee diorama—precise, airless, not my tempo.

path_3.title: Ring, The (2002)
path_3.feeling: Moody PG-13 chill—solid atmosphere, soft bite.

path_3.title: Avengers: Infinity War - Part II (2019)
path_3.feeling: Weightless grandiosity—busy, sentimental, not my circus.

path_3.title: John Wick: Chapter 3 – Parabellum (2019)
path_3.feeling: Baroque headshot ballet—slick, a bit overstuffed.

path_3.title: Out of Sight (1998)
path_3.feeling: Sly, sexy caper with clean craft and easy cool.

path_3.title: Remember the Titans (2000)
path_3.feeling: Glossy uplift machine—smooth, syrupy, not my thing.

path_3.title: What Women Want (2000)
path_3.feeling: Smug high-concept fluff—dead on arrival.

path_3.title: Eraser (1996)
path_3.feeling: 90s gunmetal cheese—serviceable kick, hollow core.

path_3.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (1998)
path_3.feeling: Drug-addled carnival—messy, abrasive, intermittently brilliant.

path_3.title: Sphere (1998)
path_3.feeling: Same leaky sub—intrigue fades, pressure doesn’t build.

path_3.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_3.feeling: Clean, patient spook story—smart craft, mild chill.

path_3.title: Deadpool (2016)
path_3.feeling: Juvenile, self-aware splatter—crude but lively.

path_3.title: Office Space (1999)
path_3.feeling: Deadpan cubicle revolt—small stakes, sharp sting.

path_3.title: Captain America: The First Avenger (2011)
path_3.feeling: Square-jawed earnestness—pleasant, thin, factory-stamped.

path_3.title: Hereditary (2018)
path_3.feeling: Immaculate craft wasted on overcooked supernatural histrionics.

path_3.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)
path_3.feeling: Bruised momentum, but choppy and thin—serviceable at best.

path_3.title: Bottle Rocket (1996)
path_3.feeling: Low-key caper charm, a little too twee and slight for me.

path_3.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut (1999)
path_3.feeling: Still a gleefully obscene musical blitz that kills me.

path_3.title: Get Shorty (1995)
path_3.feeling: Cool, snappy crime–Hollywood mash that goes down easy.

path_3.title: Gridlock'd (1997)
path_3.feeling: Bureaucratic nightmare played with grit and humor—solid.

path_3.feeling: Entertaining schadenfreude with just enough bite.

path_3.title: Requiem for a Dream (2000)
path_3.feeling: Bleak and effective, though the style sometimes shouts.

path_3.title: Videodrome (1983)
path_3.feeling: Body-horror paranoia sharpened to a vicious, prescient edge.

path_3.title: Get Out (2017)
path_3.feeling: Tight social horror with clean suspense and sharp teeth.

path_3.title: Memento (2000)
path_3.feeling: Clever clockwork noir—smart, a touch chilly.

path_3.title: ANIMA (2019)
path_3.feeling: Sleek vibes, thin meal—nice visuals, little residue.

path_3.title: Sphere (1998)
path_3.feeling: Claustrophobic setup undone by clunky ideas and flat payoff.

path_3.feeling: Quiet rigor and moral weight that land like a hammer.

path_3.title: The Hateful Eight (2015)
path_3.feeling: Poisoned chess game in a snowed-in box—glorious bile.

path_3.title: Knight's Tale, A (2001)
path_3.feeling: Cute medieval cosplay that grated fast.

path_3.title: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
path_3.feeling: Precious diorama storytelling that leaves me cold.

path_3.title: Ring, The (2002)
path_3.feeling: Moody and effective, even if the lore doesn’t thrill me.

path_3.title: Avengers: Infinity War - Part II (2019)
path_3.feeling: Grand, busy closure I respect more than enjoy.

path_3.feeling: Immaculate carnage, bloated mythmaking—fun in doses.

path_3.feeling: Sly, stylish caper with chemistry and cool.

path_3.title: Remember the Titans (2000)
path_3.feeling: Glossy uplift that slides off me.

path_3.title: What Women Want (2000)
path_3.feeling: High-concept romcom schmaltz that I can’t sit through.

path_3.title: Eraser (1996)
path_3.feeling: Goofy ’90s hardware—watchable, disposable.

path_3.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (1998)
path_3.feeling: Messy, gonzo satire with enough bite to stick.

path_3.title: Sphere (1998)
path_3.feeling: Promising premise, soggy execution and clumsy reveals.

path_3.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_3.feeling: Clean, restrained ghost story whose craft outweighs the twist.

path_3.title: Deadpool (2016)
path_3.feeling: Rude, rapid-fire fun, even if the superhero frame wears thin.

path_3.title: Office Space (1999)
path_3.feeling: Deadpan workplace rebellion that still hits a nerve.

path_3.title: Captain America: The First Avenger (2011)
path_3.feeling: Earnest pulp prologue—competent, not my flavor.

path_4.title: Hereditary (2018)

path_4.feeling: Stylish and harrowing enough that the punishment mostly pays off.

path_4.feeling: Taut amnesiac noir

path_4.feeling: Gorgeous PTA/Yorke mood piece I admired more than felt.

path_4.feeling: Procedural purity with righteous sting—my exact tempo.

path_4.feeling: Diorama whimsy and cutesy affect left me cold.

path_4.title: Avengers: Infinity War - Part II (2019)
path_4.feeling: Overstuffed closure with a few beats that land amid the bloat.

path_4.feeling: Pure choreography and world-building excess I can ride with.

path_4.feeling: Cool, sexy caper with effortless Soderbergh snap.

path_4.title: Remember the Titans (2000)
path_4.feeling: Glossy, crowd-pleasing uplift that barely moves my needle.

path_4.title: What Women Want (2000)
path_4.feeling: High-concept romcom smugness that wears thin fast.

path_4.title: Eraser (1996)

path_4.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (1998)
path_4.feeling: Gaudy, druggy spiral that fits the vibe and wears me out.

path_4.title: Sixth Sense, The (1999)
path_4.feeling: Clean, moody ghost story with a tidy hook.

path_4.title: Deadpool (2016)
path_4.feeling: Juvenile gags and bloodshed that hit enough to amuse.

path_4.title: Office Space (1999)
path_4.feeling: Deadpan cubicle rebellion that scratches my petty-vengeance itch.

path_4.title: Captain America: The First Avenger (2011)

path_4.title: Hereditary (2018)

path_4.title: Bottle Rocket (1996)

path_4.feeling: Filthy, fearless musical satire firing jokes like a machine gun—still kills me.

path_5.title: Captain America: The First Avenger (2011)
path_5.feeling: Pulp earnestness that’s fine but not my lane.

path_5.title: Hereditary (2018)
path_5.feeling: Grief-soaked occult dread that’s impeccably made but left me cold.

path_5.title: Quantum of Solace (2008)
path_5.feeling: Brisk and bruising, but the chop and thin plot kept me at arm’s length.

path_5.title: Bottle Rocket (1996)
path_5.feeling: Amiable screwup caper with charm, light and minor for me.

path_5.title: South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut (1999)
path_5.feeling: Filthy, razor-sharp musical anarchy—my sweet spot.

path_5.title: Get Shorty (1995)
path_5.feeling: Cool, sardonic crime-in-Hollywood shuffle that goes down easy.

path_5.title: Gridlock'd (1997)
path_5.feeling: Bleakly funny, humane slog through red tape that rings true.

path_5.title: FYRE: The Greatest Party That Never Happened (2019)
path_5.feeling: Scathing, brisk con-artist autopsy—catnip for me.

path_5.title: Requiem for a Dream (2000)
path_5.feeling: Visceral, punishing spiral I respect more than I enjoy.

path_5.title: Videodrome (1983)
path_5.feeling: Cold, kinky media hallucination that got under my skin.

path_5.title: Get Out (2017)
path_5.feeling: Smart, tense social horror with a satirical bite I dig.

path_5.title: Memento (2000)
path_5.feeling: Clever clockwork noir I admire more than I feel.

path_5.title: ANIMA (2019)
path_5.feeling: Sleek PTA/Yorke mood piece—pretty but slight for me.

path_5.title: Sphere (1998)
path_5.feeling: Claustrophobic setup, slick and ponderous payoff that didn’t satisfy.

path_5.title: Spotlight (2015)
path_5.feeling: Lean, righteous procedural that lands like a hammer.

path_5.title: The Hateful Eight (2015)
path_5.feeling: Talky, mean, snowbound bloodbath—delicious.

path_5.title: Knight's Tale, A (2001)
path_5.feeling: Playful pastiche that leans too cute and cornball for me.

path_5.title: Moonrise Kingdom (2012)
path_5.feeling: Meticulous, twee diorama with heart—too cutesy for me.

path_5.title: Ring, The (2002)
path_5.feeling: Moody dread works, but the curse-myth gimmick leaves me cool.

path_5.title: Avengers: Infinity War - Part II (2019)
path_5.feeling: Overstuffed cape opera—slick but emotionally weightless to me.

path_5.feeling: Beautifully brutal balletic carnage—I’m in.

path_5.title: What Women Want (2000)
